tool.name: OTB.PixelValue
tool.description: Get the value of a pixel.
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin False output_data_value $output_data_value name OTB.PixelValue in $in coordx $coordx coordy $coordy mode $mode mode_epsg_code $mode_epsg_code cl '$cl' prefer $prefer response $response transmissionMode_value $OutputSection_value.transmissionMode_value

param.name: in
param.label: Input image
param.help: Input image The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, png, tiff

param.name: coordx
param.label: This will be the X coordinate interpreted depending on the chosen mode
param.help: This will be the X coordinate interpreted depending on the chosen mode

param.name: coordy
param.label: This will be the Y coordinate interpreted depending on the chosen mode
param.help: This will be the Y coordinate interpreted depending on the chosen mode

param.name: mode
param.label: Different modes can be selected, default mode is Index.
param.help: Different modes can be selected, default mode is Index.

param.name: mode_epsg_code
param.label: This code is used to define a geographical coordinate system. If no system is specified, WGS84 (EPSG : 4326) is used by default.
param.help: This code is used to define a geographical coordinate system. If no system is specified, WGS84 (EPSG : 4326) is used by default.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_value
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: This application gives the value of a selected pixel. There are three ways to designate a pixel, with its index, its physical coordinate (in the physical space attached to the image), and with geographical coordinate system. Coordinates will be interpreted differently depending on which mode is chosen.
